org.kaaproject.kaa.client

Interface GenericKaaClient

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    KaaClient
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractKaaClient, BaseKaaClient

    public interface GenericKaaClient

    Root interface for the Kaa client. This interface contain methods that are predefined and does not contain any auto-generated code.

    Author:
    Yaroslav Zeygerman, Andrew Shvayka
    See Also:
    ConfigurationStorage, NotificationManager, EventFamilyFactory, EndpointRegistrationManager, EventListenersResolver, KaaChannelManager, PublicKey, PrivateKey, KaaDataChannel

        See Also:

      • addNotificationListener

        void addNotificationListener(Long topicId,
                             NotificationListener listener)
                      throws UnavailableTopicException

        Add listener to receive notifications relating to the specified topic.

        Listener(s) for optional topics may be added/removed irrespective to whether subscription was already or not.

        Parameters:
        topicId - Id of topic (both mandatory and optional).
        listener - Listener to receive notifications.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTopicException - Throw if unknown topic id is provided.
        See Also:
        NotificationListener

      • removeNotificationListener

        void removeNotificationListener(NotificationListener listener)

        Remove listener receiving all notifications (both for mandatory and optional topics).

        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to receive notifications
        See Also:
        NotificationListener

      • removeNotificationListener

        void removeNotificationListener(Long topicId,
                                NotificationListener listener)
                         throws UnavailableTopicException

        Remove listener receiving notifications for the specified topic.

        Listener(s) for optional topics may be added/removed irrespective to whether subscription was already or not.

        Parameters:
        topicId - Id of topic (both mandatory and optional).
        listener - Listener to receive notifications.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTopicException - Throw if unknown topic id is provided.
        See Also:
        NotificationListener

      • subscribeToTopic

        void subscribeToTopic(Long topicId)
               throws UnavailableTopicException

        Subscribe to notifications relating to the specified optional topic.

        Parameters:
        topicId - Id of a optional topic.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTopicException - Throw if unknown topic id is provided or topic isn't optional.

      • subscribeToTopic

        void subscribeToTopic(Long topicId,
                      boolean forceSync)
               throws UnavailableTopicException

        Subscribe to notifications relating to the specified optional topic.

        Parameters:
        topicId - Id of a optional topic.
        forceSync - Define whether current subscription update should be accepted immediately.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTopicException - Throw if unknown topic id is provided or topic isn't optional.
        See Also:
        syncTopicsList()

      • subscribeToTopics

        Parameters:
        topicIds - List of optional topic id.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTopicException - Throw if unknown topic id is provided or topic isn't optional.

        See Also:
        syncTopicsList()

      • unsubscribeFromTopic

        void unsubscribeFromTopic(Long topicId)
                   throws UnavailableTopicException

        Unsubscribe from notifications relating to the specified optional topic.

        All previously added listeners will be removed automatically.

        Parameters:
        topicId - Id of a optional topic.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTopicException - Throw if unknown topic id is provided or topic isn't optional.

      • unsubscribeFromTopic

        void unsubscribeFromTopic(Long topicId,
                          boolean forceSync)
                   throws UnavailableTopicException

        Unsubscribe from notifications relating to the specified optional topic.

        All previously added listeners will be removed automatically.

        Parameters:
        topicId - Id of a optional topic.
        forceSync - Define whether current subscription update should be accepted immediately.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTopicException - Throw if unknown topic id is provided or topic isn't optional.
        See Also:
        syncTopicsList()

      • unsubscribeFromTopics

        void unsubscribeFromTopics(List<Long> topicIds)
                    throws UnavailableTopicException

        Unsubscribe from notifications relating to the specified list of optional topics.

        All previously added listeners will be removed automatically.

        Parameters:
        topicIds - List of optional topic id.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTopicException - Throw if unknown topic id is provided or topic isn't optional.

      • unsubscribeFromTopics

        void unsubscribeFromTopics(List<Long> topicIds,
                           boolean forceSync)
                    throws UnavailableTopicException

        Unsubscribe from notifications relating to the specified list of optional topics.

        All previously added listeners will be removed automatically.

        Parameters:
        topicIds - List of optional topic id.
        forceSync - Define whether current subscription update should be accepted immediately.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTopicException - Throw if unknown topic id is provided or topic isn't optional.
        See Also:
        syncTopicsList()

      • syncTopicsList

        void syncTopicsList()

        Force sync of pending subscription changes with server.

        Should be used after all subscribeToTopic(Long, boolean), subscribeToTopics(List, boolean), unsubscribeFromTopic(Long, boolean), unsubscribeFromTopics(List, boolean) calls with parameter forceSync set to false.

        Use it as a convenient way to make different consequent changes in the optional subscription: 

         {
     // Make subscription changes
     kaaClient.subscribeOnTopics(Arrays.asList("optional_topic1", "optional_topic2", "optional_topic3"), false);
     kaaClient.unsubscribeFromTopic("optional_topic4", false);

     // Add listeners for topics here

     // Commit changes
     kaaClient.syncTopicsList();
 }

      • findEventListeners

        void findEventListeners(List<String> eventFQNs,
                        FindEventListenersCallback listener)
        Submits an event listeners resolution request
        Parameters:
        eventFQNs - List of event class FQNs which have to be supported by endpoint.
        listener - Result listener FindEventListenersCallback}

      • getChannelManager

        KaaChannelManager getChannelManager()
        Retrieves Kaa channel manager
        Returns:
        KaaChannelManager object

      • getClientPublicKey

        PublicKey getClientPublicKey()

        Retrieves the client's public key.

        Required in user implementation of an operation data channel. Public key hash (SHA-1) is used by servers as identification number to uniquely identify each connected endpoint.

        Returns:
        client's public key

      • getClientPrivateKey

        PrivateKey getClientPrivateKey()

        Retrieves the client's private key.

        Required in user implementation of an operation data channel. Private key is used by encryption schema between endpoint and servers.

        Returns:
        client's private key

      • getEndpointKeyHash

        String getEndpointKeyHash()

        Retrieves endpoint public key hash.

        Required in EndpointRegistrationManager implementation to react on detach response from Operations server.

        Returns:
        String containing current endpoint's public key hash.

      • setEndpointAccessToken

        void setEndpointAccessToken(String token)
        Set new access token for a current endpoint
        Parameters:
        token - the token

      • refreshEndpointAccessToken

        String refreshEndpointAccessToken()
        Generate new access token for a current endpoint
        Returns:
        String containing new endpoint access token

      • getEndpointAccessToken

        String getEndpointAccessToken()
        Retrieve an access token for a current endpoint
        Returns:
        String containing current endpoint access token

      • attachEndpoint

        void attachEndpoint(EndpointAccessToken endpointAccessToken,
                    OnAttachEndpointOperationCallback resultListener)
        Updates with new endpoint attach request

        OnAttachEndpointOperationCallback is populated with EndpointKeyHash of an attached endpoint.
        Parameters:
        endpointAccessToken - Access token of the attaching endpoint
        resultListener - Listener to notify about result of the endpoint attaching
        See Also:
        EndpointAccessToken, OnAttachEndpointOperationCallback

      • detachEndpoint

        void detachEndpoint(EndpointKeyHash endpointKeyHash,
                    OnDetachEndpointOperationCallback resultListener)
        Updates with new endpoint detach request
        Parameters:
        endpointKeyHash - Key hash of the detaching endpoint
        resultListener - Listener to notify about result of the enpoint attaching
        See Also:
        EndpointKeyHash, OnDetachEndpointOperationCallback

      • attachUser

        void attachUser(String userExternalId,
                String userAccessToken,
                UserAttachCallback callback)
        Creates user attach request using default verifier. Default verifier is selected during SDK generation. If there was no default verifier selected this method will throw runtime exception.
        Parameters:
        userExternalId - the user external id
        userAccessToken - the user access token
        callback - called when authentication result received
        See Also:
        UserAttachCallback

      • attachUser

        void attachUser(String userVerifierToken,
                String userExternalId,
                String userAccessToken,
                UserAttachCallback callback)
        Creates user attach request using specified verifier.
        Parameters:
        userVerifierToken - the user verifier token
        userExternalId - the user external id
        userAccessToken - the user access token
        callback - called when authentication result received
        See Also:
        UserAttachCallback

      • isAttachedToUser

        boolean isAttachedToUser()
        Checks if current endpoint is attached to user.
        Returns:
        true if current endpoint is attached to any user, false otherwise.
